results.title: Wave twisters
results.creator_credit: Eric Henry, Syd Garon, Yoga Frog and Thud Rumble Ltd
results.brief_description: A mind bending film that melds 3D and 2D animation, science fiction, 20th century pop culture, and, most prominently, hip-hop. “Wave twisters” was the idea of superstar hip-hop DJ Qbert, who created an album, “Wave twisters”, which he hoped to fashion into a film of sorts. Three years later it became a reality with this film that is set entirely to the soundtrack of his album. The story joins the Inter Dental Space Commander and his assistants, Honey and Rubbish, who are having a messy day at work when their spaceship comes under attack from the thuggish Redworm. The Dental Space Commander and his assistants escape with the prized artefact the Wave Twister, which came from the hip-hop planet Quasar 16.33.45.78. The band of heroes, with B-Boy Grandpa, go to the planet hoping to revive the lost arts of hip-hop (scratching, rapping, breakdancing, and graffiti) which has been outlawed by the tyrannical Lord Ook and enforced by his Octobots and the master turntablism of DJ QBert, D-Styles, and Yoga Frog. Full of references to the new (virus scanners, internet, music downloads), and old (muscle cars, old video games, and schlocky science fiction), “Wave twisters” is a film that is a must for hip-hop and animation fans alike.

results.title: Watt's last voyage
results.creator_credit: Brian Davies and University of Melbourne. Film Society
results.brief_description: A tale told with humour and pathos; a yarn spun between decks about an old salt whose bitter experiences one friendless dawn persuade him to abandon wayfaring for wading. Cast includes Graeme Blundell, Robin Laurie, John Wregg.

results.title: Watership down
results.brief_description:
One dim moonlit night, a small band of rabbits leave the comfort and safety of their warren and set out on a long and dangerous journey after a premonition of a terrible disaster that will overtake them if they stay. None of them knows where they are heading, or the dangers they will face in their search for a new warren where they can live in peace. Adapted from Richard Adams’ modern classic.
Voiced by actors including: John Hurt, Richard Briers, Ralph Richardson, Denholm Elliott, Zero Mostel, Nigel Hawthorne, Michael Hordern, Joss Ackland.

results.title: Waterfowl in action
results.creator_credit: University of Minnesota. Audio-Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Migrating waterfowl are filmed as they stop to feed and rest in the marshes near Wheaton, Minnesota. The Franklin gull, gadwall, spoonbill, green and blue winged teal, the diving ducks, blue and lesser snow geese, whistling swans and others are shown on the water and in flight. Feeding habits and identifying field marks are explained. NB: In this film waterfowl are seen as potential targets for sporting shooters and so must be conserved to keep the sport going!

results.title: Water: our national asset
results.creator_credit: B.F.C. Barrington and State Rivers and Water Supply Commission
results.brief_description: Shows the selection, development, maintenance and operation of irrigation schemes. Emphasises the importance of irrigation in keeping drought in check and increasing primary production.

results.title: Water service
results.creator_credit: David MacKane, C A Radley and Selwyn Films
results.brief_description: How water is carried from lakes and streams to the reservoirs where it is put through filter beds to be purified, before being piped from power-houses to the consumers. Samples of water are continually being tested for contamination and impurities.

results.title: Water safety: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Michael Delean and Michael Delean and Associates
results.brief_description: Water accidents can be prevented if you know which situations spell danger. But if you find yourself or someone else in trouble in the water, there are specific techniques which can save lives or buy time until help arrives. Here are illustrated a variety of ways to avoid water accidents, the right and wrong ways of helping yourself or someone else in trouble, and survival floating techniques.

results.title: Water movement in soils
results.creator_credit: J.C. Haish, W.E. Gardner and Washington State University
results.brief_description: The demonstration, using a model of a vertical section through the soil and time lapse photography, shows how liquid moves through soil of various compositions. The elements of the soil, which control the movement of water and liquid fertiliser, are of major importance in agriculture, irrigation, erosion control etc.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.C. Haish, W.E. Gardner and Washington State University

results.title: Water erosion and waterlogging
results.creator_credit: Gerry North and Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Water erosion can result in the complete degradation of land by the removal of topsoils to expose infertile clay subsoils. The adoption of minimum tillage and other farm management techniques can lessen the risk of water erosion and improve farm productivity.

results.title: Watching them write, seeing them learn: a kindergarten writing community at work
results.creator_credit: Brian Butler and Riverina College of Advanced Education. Literacy Centre
results.brief_description: Kindergarten children experiment with written language. There are no formal writing lessons and they are left free to learn by trial and error. Narrated by Barbara Kamler.
